abstract: The Obama administration has chosen a Treasury Department lawyer to replace Kenneth R. Feinberg, its special master for executive compensation, who stepped down Friday, ending a contentious 14-month tenure.
snippet: The Obama administration has chosen a Treasury Department lawyer to replace Kenneth R. Feinberg, its special master for executive compensation, who stepped down Friday, ending a contentious 14-month tenure.
lead_paragraph: The Obama administration has chosen a Treasury Department lawyer to replace Kenneth R. Feinberg, its special master for executive compensation, who stepped down Friday, ending a contentious 14-month tenure, The Associated Press reports.

headline.main: Treasury Lawyer Replaces Feinberg as Pay Czar
